Pico Geyer wrote:

>Thanks Andrew.
>  
>

No problem.

> 
>
>The example you provided was a great help.
>
>I have another related question though: 
>
>If the class that your are creating a wrapper for (in our example NetworkInterface) has static methods, your forced to leave these static methods out of the interface because you can't declare a static method in a interface. This would mean that these methods can't be included in your mock object.
>
>  
>

Basically you'll need  to do as Chris suggests.
